title: The Fikes Companies Selects Verifone for Streamlined EMV Migration & Enhanced Management Capabilities across Its CEFCO Convenience Store Chain
text:
The Fikes Companies Selects Verifone for Streamlined EMV Migration & Enhanced Management Capabilities across Its CEFCO Convenience Store Chain [September 15, 2015] The Fikes Companies Selects Verifone for Streamlined EMV Migration & Enhanced Management Capabilities across Its CEFCO Convenience Store Chain Tweet 
Verifone (NYSE: PAY) today announced that its Commander Site Controller and Ruby2 POS solutions have been selected by The Fikes Companies for deployment across its entire chain of CEFCO Convenience Stores. One of the top 40 largest company-operated convenience store chains in the U.S., CEFCO operates 227 convenience stores within Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Louisiana, Mississippi, Oklahoma and Texas. This Smart News Release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20150915006046/en/ The Fikes Companies Selects Verifone for Streamlined EMV Migration & Enhanced Management Capabilities across Its CEFCO Convenience Store Chain (Photo: Business Wire) 
EXPEDITED EMV MIGRATION 
Verifone's solutions will provide CEFCO an EMV-ready platform that enables the chain to support EMV in its stores in time for the October 2015 EMV liability shift . In addition to reducing complexity by separating payment, fuel and POS software for easier management and remote upgrades, the solutions will also enable CEFCO to support EMV at-the-pump in time for the October 2017 EMV liability shift that applies to the petroleum forecourt. 
"Our goal is to standardize and consolidate our payment systems with a solution that gives our entire chain of CEFCO stores the most efficient path to EMV acceptance," said H. Lorne Brockway, vice president of Information Technology for The Fikes Companies. "Verifone's partnership will enable us to not only support EMV in time for the liability shift deadlines, but also improve our store management capabilities and expand our use of the solution in the future." 
The rollout, which is currently underway and expected to be completed by the end of 2015, is being managed by Verifone's Authorized Service Contractor network. 
SINGLE INTEGRATED SITE SOLUTION 
Commander Site Controller from Verifone is a single site management software platform that supports all petroleum and card brands, providing increased speed in at-the-pump and in-store payment acceptance, fueling operations and back office control. 
Key benefits of Commander Site Controller include: Increased speed of payment, fueling and store control through 100 percent IP data transfe Future-proof, expandable architecture for added functionality Remote access for real-time updates and operations management from any web-enabled device, including tablets and smartphones Commander Site Controller features Commander Console - a cloud-based software management system allowing managers and owners to manage all aspects of their business, including payment, in-store and forecourt operations. It includes an iOS and Android ( News - Alert ) mobile app through which store managers can access a graphical set of operational matrixes that are easy to navigate. 
ENHANCED CHECKOUT & CENTRALIZED STORE MANAGEMENT 
Commander Site Controller supports Ruby2 , Verifone's latest POS solution built specifically to endure harsh convenience store environments. Its touch-screen console provides fast, efficient order taking and payment processing, and its multi-core processor allows for streamlined store and customer management - all through a centralized device that increases space at the counter with its small footprint for each work station. 
Key benefits of Ruby2 include: Increased checkout speed Customizable , easy to use touch-screen Small footprint Flexibility to support future business needs Full workstation access to store operation components such as price changes, store updates and software program management 
"Merchants in all verticals are challenged by the migration to EMV as well as the rapidly changing payment technology landscape," said Dan Yienger, senior vice president of Petroleum for Verifone. "Fikes' forward-thinking approach to payments will simplify and expedite its move to EMV, while at the same time putting in place a flexible, standardized payment system that is easy to use and can grow with future business needs."

About The FIKES Companies 
The Fikes Companies ("FIKES") is a group of six family owned business units. Fikes Wholesale, Inc. which is our petroleum products marketing business distributes fuel to commercial and retail accounts throughout the United States through strategic relationships with Shell, ExxonMobil, ChevronTexaco, Citgo, Valero, and numerous independent fuel suppliers ( www.fikesinc.com ). Fikes Terminals began operations in 2015 and supplies finished products from our 80,000 barrel fuel terminal in Waco, Texas. Our convenience retailing business markets through our network of approximately two hundred and twenty seven CEFCO and Food Fast branded convenience stores located in Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Louisiana, Mississippi, Oklahoma, and Texas ( www.cefcostores.com ). CORD Financial Services specializes in ATM sales, placements and credit card processing services. CORD provides these services to over 8,000 locations throughout the United States ( www.cordfinancial.com ). Our Group Petroleum Services transportation business consists of twenty-eight fuel delivery trucks ( www.gpscarriers.com ), and our JF Air Traffic charter airline service operates through a partnership with Landmark Aviation. 
About Verifone 
Verifone is transforming everyday transactions into opportunities for connected commerce. We're connecting more than 27 million payment devices to the cloud - merging the online and in-store shopping experience and creating the next generation of digital engagement between merchants and consumers. We are built on a 30-year history of uncompromised security. Our people are known as trusted experts that work with our clients and partners, helping to solve their most complex payments challenges. We have clients and partners in more than 150 countries, including the world's best-known retail brands, financial institutions and payment providers.
